title: Daniel Hamilton First Player To Finish UConn Men's Husky Run
text:
Daniel Hamilton First Player To Finish UConn Men's Husky Run Kevin Ollie Thanks Runners After Annual Husky Run 
UConn men's basketball coach Kevin Ollie thanks Husky Run participants Wednesday for being a part of the team's process. 
UConn men's basketball coach Kevin Ollie thanks Husky Run participants Wednesday for being a part of the team's process. Kentan Facey UConn men's Husky Run covers 3.4 miles through campus 
STORRS -â€” On your mark, get set. Basketball season is officially out of the blocks at UConn with the running of the annual Husky Run on Wednesday. 
The UConn men's players, joined by their classmates, ran a 3.1-mile course around the campus in the traditional event to start the formal practice phase of the preseason. Daniel Hamilton was the first player across the finish line. His time was 20 minutes, 31 seconds. Kentan Facey was second among the players (20:31) and Omar Calhoun was third (22:43). Caption UConn Husky Run Mark Mirko / Hartford Courant 
Runners, including Daniel Hamilton (left with headphones) jump from the starting line to begin Wednesday's Husky Run at UConn.

Anthony Fuentes (L) and his teammate on the Welcox cross country team stretch before the start of Wednesday's fun run at UConn. 
Anthony Fuentes (L) and his teammate on the Welcox cross country team stretch before the start of Wednesday's fun run at UConn. (Mark Mirko / Hartford Courant) 
"I'm in the best shape of my life," Hamiton said after the race. "I said two weeks ago I was going to win, I had to live up to that." 
Jon Gill, a senior at Lyman Hall High in Wallingford, defended his title, winning in 17:45. 
The Huskies first practice will be Saturday. 
Amida Brimah, Omar Calhoun and Kevin Ollie were the top three finishers last year, but Ollie sat out this year due to some sore knees.
